Creator for the #AtariST computers were THE #MIDI sequencing tool back in the day. It morphed into LogicPro and got acquired by #Apple.

#Retrogames #Atari #retroaudio https://t.co/yjlZAEEoko

Networking for computers back in 1991 is not a straight forward. Different connector, speed and protocol. This 10BaseT Hub makes it a bit easier by sticking to network standard. 
https://t.co/1m93y7Zbx3

Address Book Plus 2.0 has a cool feature that prints your data out into a nice booklet format. If you lots of phone numbers and addresses, searching it would be a nightmare. This comes with MacTools.

The key in the OCR is the SW. The scanner has to be good enough resolution for the OCR to do the analysis. Handheld scanning is problematic as you need a steady hand and ability to move at same speed. 
https://t.co/HQi0FJOqn0
#Retrocomputing #Retrotech #Apple https://t.co/FfQ1qwxPkW

Fear of harmful radiation was big news back in 1991. Here is an offer from NoRad that claims to reduced 99.9999% of radiation. Was there an instrument that can measure with such accuracy?
https://t.co/gCDTFcIlEd

@Finselbix Tight but nice setup!
@sonophoto100doc @tehnyit Yep, used HylaFAX back in the day. It was pretty cool. I think you can setup a network of fax servers around the world to avoid international dialing charges with Hylafax.
